intro: Ononis zaiana, commonly known as the Cyprus ononise, is a flowering plant native to the island of Cyprus. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate. It has compound leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Ononis zaiana is often found in open habitats such as scrublands and coastal areas.
